intro: Lissanthe propinqua, commonly known as the narrowleaf lissanthe, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and similar species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, while its small, bell-shaped flowers are usually pale blue or white. Lissanthe propinqua is often found in swampy areas and is adapted to thrive in wet, nutrient-poor soils.
